53968a86ac4d321c6710ce12cedf409a (02:03): I am using cpanel on my new webserver. Would it be better to setup accounts for my clients while logged in as root, in 2087, or would it be better to set myself up with a reseller account, then login there, and setup my clients as addon domains?
77276cde892307ce6b7a98500d1f406c (02:03): ChrisC35: don't think it makes any difference
77276cde892307ce6b7a98500d1f406c (02:04): ChrisC35: Its not hard to move the files if need be
7ac8f8cf65a7a0b4ea7635148640d197 (02:04): dont do it... for the love of god!!  only use root *where* 100% needed
5e7ea781779a9b70a013bb242c722fea (02:04): if you're admining a server, you should know about that
53968a86ac4d321c6710ce12cedf409a (02:04): i wont use the reseller then seems like an unnecessary layer
77276cde892307ce6b7a98500d1f406c (02:04): I can't be bothered to explain :)
7ac8f8cf65a7a0b4ea7635148640d197 (02:04): i still dont see why people use things like cpanel, takes all the fun and learning away

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:05): positive: no comments; negative: ->Network--->Linux Firewall (Sneaky_Bastard), i hate it (jink), i still hate it (jink); overall: -5.

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:10): ftp is a rather insecure protocol primarily used to announce your shell password to the world. or better replaced by ssh/scp/sftp in most cases or mod_dav in other cases or a cause of "No such file or directory" in CGI scripts, if you transfer as binary with DOS lineends
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:10): sftp is a secure ftp-like protocol, piggybacked over ssh. http://www.openssh.org/
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:10): ssh is Secure SHell, a way to securely login to another machine.
